image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Police and the SA Premier are urging a man who was seen at Adelaide's March for Australia holding an "offensive" and "outrageous" sign depicting alleged killer and wanted man Dezi Freeman to hand himself in.

title.children: Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally 'disgraceful', SA Police say

image.altText: A soy sauce container in the shape of a fish.

props.synopsis: South Australia has become the first state in Australia to ban fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers as it continues to phase out single-use plastics. The premier says the state is leading the way and he expects other states will follow.

title.children: Nation-first ban on fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers begins in SA

image.altText: A bearded older man wears an oxygen tube, holds a broken tile and a tile cutter next to a bonding glue in a room

props.synopsis: Under the careful tutelage of Albert "Doc" Todd, patients at a South Australian palliative care service are turning plain tables into colourful pieces of art.

title.children: Hospital art project helps 'leave a glow', palliative care patient says

image.altText: Sonnet shouts happily, her arms in the air in love-you hand gesture, red hill, dirt, shows the ouback. She wears white shirt.

props.synopsis: Sonnet Cure is a singer in two bands and starred in the ABC's Headliners TV show. She was born deaf in one ear, so writing music is as much about "feeling it" as hearing it.

title.children: Deaf muso says community key for performers with disability

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Documents reveal the scale of carbon pollution leaking from a Darwin LNG tank was like adding 8,300 new cars to the road every year. It is about to be filled again.

title.children: 'Huge' leak from gas plant kept secret from public in 'national scandal'

image.altText: Old, rusty, red ute on the right hand side. Red dirt and clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: In the remote town of Andamooka, even native plants struggle to survive. Scientists are trying to find a solution to food security, a problem shared by outback residents and future space travellers.

title.children: Outback SA is likened to Mars. Would it be easier to grow plants there?

image.altText: Adelaide 36ers player Ben Griscti hold the ball and eyes the basket as he gets ready for a shot in training.

props.synopsis: Adelaide 36ers player Ben Griscti has been injured during a training session after a backboard collapsed on top of him.

title.children: NBL player injured when backboard collapses on him following dunk

image.altText: a young woman leans against a wall staring at the camera with a somber expression

props.synopsis: From poorly categorised NDIS support to high rates of suicide, Tourette syndrome advocates say it's the last disability where "it's still acceptable for people to laugh at".

title.children: 'Loudest in the room ... yet still invisible': Tourette syndrome advocates plead for change

image.altText: A man in a cap and jacket stands in front of black stud inside a barn

props.synopsis: Farmers have turned out in droves to compete at South Australia's largest agricultural event after a challenging year facing drought conditions.

title.children: Families and farmers flock to SA's largest carnival and agricultural show

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man diving from a height in front of people watching and boathouses on a river

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Nelson has endured tough times over the past five years, but now a small group of friends plans to revive an event that attracted huge crowds up until the 1970s.

title.children: Can this historic regatta coax tourists back to struggling river town?

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and hat in a bus filled with glassware cabinets.

props.synopsis: At 33, house painter Jeff Morgan broke his hand and suffered a strange injury that unravelled his life. It was at the kitchen table, where his children were painting with watercolours, that he found his calling.

title.children: House painter turned 'kaleidoscope bus' artist finds his calling

image.altText: A birdseye view of a white car with its four doors open on a lawn, stationary next to a flag pole with a Russian flag.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating what caused a car to enter the grounds of the Consulate General of the Russian Federation in Sydney's east.

title.children: Car rams gate of Russian consulate after reports of 'suspicious vehicle'

image.altText: FILE PHOTO: Republican presidential nominee and former U.S. President Donald Trump holds a campaign rally in Novi, Michigan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's declaration that, "I have the right to do anything I want", didn't get the attention it deserved.

title.children: This authoritarian Trump statement didn't get the attention it deserves

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs by night.

props.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man who died after being put in a "bear hug" is suing his Alice Springs disability care provider for negligence.

title.children: Aboriginal man died after carer put him in 'bear hug', family claims

image.altText: An iPhone screen

props.synopsis: The study, which will inform the government's impending social media ban for under-16s, found several methods were viable, but no method was foolproof, with concerns over both accuracy and privacy.

title.children: Social media age verification possible but laden with risks, study warns

image.altText: A masked man wearing military combat camouflage gear.

props.synopsis: Since the war began, Abu Obeida had issued dozens of televised speeches, always appearing in military fatigues and a red keffiyeh scarf to obscure his face, and published audio messages, press releases and social media posts.

title.children: Hamas chief spokesperson killed in strikes, Israel says

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Victoria Police believe alleged gunman Dezi Freeman is being helped by people in the community, saying "people know the whereabouts of the person who has killed two cops".

title.children: Police believe Dezi Freeman is being helped, saying 'people know' gunman's whereabouts

image.altText: men seated with tea kettles and cups on either side of wooden long table. four flags in the middle on short edge. flowers in ce

props.synopsis: The Chinese president and Indian prime minister pledged to resolve their border differences and bolster cooperation ahead of the opening of a regional summit.

title.children: 'The dragon and elephant' should 'dance,' Xi tells Modi at trade talks

image.altText: Aerial shot of suburban streets of housing

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have been pushed higher again in August as lower interest rates, rising real wages and buyer optimism collided with a shortage of homes for sale.

title.children: House prices rising in 'seller's market' as new listings below average

image.altText: A side profile of a man wearing a lei, and a grey and black patterned island shirt.

props.synopsis: The reign of Samoa's first female prime minister is almost certainly over, with provisional results in Friday's national poll indicating a new government will lead the Pacific nation after months of political turmoil.

title.children: Samoa's first female leader loses, as likely new PM says 'god centred' leadership coming

image.altText: A man in a suit surrounded by police.

props.synopsis: The arrest of a former president has ignited debate over whether Sri Lanka's government is pursuing genuine reform or political theatre, nearly a year into its rule.

title.children: Sri Lanka's anti-corruption drive has chosen a 'puzzling' target, expert says

image.altText: Federal MP Bob Katter

props.synopsis: If the parliament does not take action — even symbolically — against Bob Katter's threats to punch a journalist, the perception of double standards will be hard to avoid.

title.children: The response to Katter's outburst will test parliament this week

image.altText: Pat McCabe

props.synopsis: They served their country, but veterans are struggling to find GPs that accept the veteran healthcare card, leaving them stranded.

title.children: Pat served her country. Now she's battling to find a GP

image.altText: A young woman is packing clothes into a suitcase, sitting on a bed in a well-lit room

props.synopsis: Here's what experts have to say about the origins and value of these popular personality types.

title.children: Type A or Type B? Why we love to categorise ourselves

image.altText: Celestino and Michelle hold a photo of Jasmine on her wedding day.

props.synopsis: A new report paints a picture of a system that has failed to deliver fast and fair access to treatment for people with rare and less common cancers.

title.children: A 'cancer lottery': Surviving cancer comes down to this, according to new report

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The ASX retreats to open the week after Wall Street investors bailed on technology stocks on Friday. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Australian stocks sell off while gold price nears all-time high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: More troubles at aging Yallourn power plant
ASX slide continues led by miners, banks and tech stocks
Gold's record high driven by US dollar weakness

image.altText: Four Houthis holding up rifles and wearing scarves around their heads.

props.synopsis: Iran-backed Houthis have raided the offices of the United Nations' food, health and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining 11 UN employees, officials said.

title.children: Houthi rebels raid UN offices in Yemen, detain at least 11 employees

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits on a bench, with bush behind her.

props.synopsis: Residents at a seaside caravan park in northern Tasmania own their own homes, but the park is no longer allowing sales due to council rules that say the land is not approved for residential use.

title.children: 'It can't be moved': Caravan park resident told she can't sell her home

image.altText: A line of people look at their mobile phones.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of teenagers get their health advice on social media, but a researcher says much of it is a "waste of time and money" and at worst, potentially harmful.

title.children: Teens warned misinformation about health is 'rife' on social media

image.altText: Nina Kennedy holding the Australian flag

props.synopsis: Nina Kennedy is ready to compete at the World Championships after cramming a four-month recovery into six weeks, even if she doesn't fully trust her body quite yet.

title.children: Kennedy to return for World Championships despite suffering 'niggles everywhere'

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz with his racquet in his left hand celebrating

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz and Jessica Pegula show their class in booking their spots in the US Open quarterfinals, while Sorana Cirstea sends out a plea over a missing piece of sentimental silverware.

title.children: Alcaraz's trick shot stuns fans, star's trophy stolen from US Open hotel room

image.altText: Dominik Szoboszlai celebrates with Liverpool teammates

props.synopsis: Dominik Szoboszlai unleashes the longest goal of the English Premier League season to help Liverpool strike the first telling blow in this year's title race against last year's runner-up Arsenal.

title.children: Stunning long-range strike helps Liverpool claim clash of EPL heavyweights

image.altText: Oscar Piastri on the podium, holding the winner's trophy and smiling

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has won the Formula 1 Dutch Grand Prix from pole, while his championship rival Lando Norris failed to finish.

title.children: Piastri wins and takes big lead in F1 title race as Norris goes up in smoke
